meta.dc:rights: The Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

docTitle.name: shortTitle
docTitle.content: Merchant Shipping (Control of Ballast Water and Sediments) Regulation

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: Administration (主管機關), in relation to a non-Hong Kong ship, means the government of any place outside Hong Kong whose flag the ship is entitled to fly;
Ballast Water Management Plan (壓載水管理計劃) means the Ballast Water Management Plan referred to in section 7;

Convention (《公約》) means the International Convention for the Control and Management of Ships’ Ballast Water and Sediments, 2004, as from time to time revised or amended by any revision or amendment to any provision of such Convention that applies to Hong Kong;
Convention country (公約國) means a country which is a party to the Convention;
electronic record book (電子紀錄簿) means a device or system used for recording in electronic form the matters required to be recorded in a Ballast Water Record Book under section 8; (L.N. 106 of 2025)
Government surveyor (政府驗船師) means a person appointed under section 36 to be a Government surveyor;
IMO means the International Maritime Organization;

International Ballast Water Management Certificate (國際壓載水管理證書) means—(a)an IBWM Certificate;(b)an International Ballast Water Management Certificate issued by an organization recognized under section 37; or(c)an International Ballast Water Management Certificate issued by or under the authority of an Administration;
non-Hong Kong ship (非香港船舶) means a ship other than a Hong Kong ship;
sediments (沉積物) means any matter settled out of ballast water in a ship.

subsection.leadIn: This Regulation applies to the following ships which are engaged in international voyages—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Hong Kong ship wherever it may be;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a non-Hong Kong ship that is within the waters of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: This Regulation does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a ship that is not designed or built to carry ballast water;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a ship that carries ballast water in sealed tanks such that the ballast water is not subject to discharge;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a warship;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a naval auxiliary; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other ship owned or operated by a government and used only on government non-commercial service.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: international voyage (國際航程) means—(a)a voyage between Hong Kong and a port outside the People’s Republic of China; or(b)a voyage between a port in a Convention country and a port outside that country (whether in another Convention country or not).

subsection.content: Subject to section 5, a ship must, in relation to the discharge of ballast water on the ship, have an approved ballast water management system, unless the ballast water is discharged into a reception facility.
Subject to section 5, a ship must conduct ballast water management on the ship that meets the standard that is applicable to the ship as set out in Regulation B-3 of the Annex to the Convention.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: approved ballast water management system (認可壓載水管理系統) means a ballast water management system of a type in respect of which a Type Approval Certificate has been issued;

ballast water management system (壓載水管理系統) means any mechanical, physical, chemical or biological process, or any combination of such processes, to remove, render harmless or avoid the uptake or discharge of harmful aquatic organisms and pathogens in ballast water and sediments;

harmful aquatic organisms and pathogens (有害水生物及病原體) means any aquatic organisms or pathogens which, if introduced into the sea (including estuaries) or fresh water courses, may create hazards to the environment or human health, harm organisms, damage amenities, impair biological diversity or interfere with other legitimate uses of such areas;

Type Approval Certificate (型式認可證書) means a certificate of ballast water management system issued by the Director, or by or under the authority of an Administration, certifying that a type of ballast water management system meets the standard specified by IMO.

subsection.content: A ship is not required to comply with the requirements in section 4 in the circumstances set out in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The circumstances are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the uptake or discharge of ballast water and sediments is necessary for ensuring the safety of the ship in emergency situation or saving life at sea;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the accidental discharge or ingress of ballast water and sediments resulting from damage to the ship or its equipment, and all reasonable precautions have been taken, before and after the occurrence of the damage or discovery of the damage, discharge or ingress, for preventing or minimizing any accidental discharge or ingress of ballast water and sediments;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the uptake or discharge of ballast water and sediments is for avoiding or minimizing the effect of pollution incidents from the ship;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the uptake and the subsequent discharge into the high seas of ballast water and sediments;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the whole of the ballast water and sediments originating from an area is not mixed with unmanaged ballast water and sediments taken from another area, the discharge of those ballast water and sediments from the ship at the first-mentioned area.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Ballast water exchange
section.content: If, because of section 4, the standard that must be met for conducting ballast water management on a ship is the standard set out in Regulation D-1 of the Annex to the Convention, then the ship, when conducting ballast water exchange on board, must comply with the requirements set out in Regulation B-4 of the Annex to the Convention.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Ballast Water Management Plan
section.content: A ship must have on board, and implement, a Ballast Water Management Plan which is specific to the ship and approved by the Director or an Administration in accordance with the guidelines issued by IMO.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Duty to maintain Ballast Water Record Book

subsection.leadIn: A Ballast Water Record Book (Record Book) must be maintained for a ship and must contain the following information in relation to the ship— (L.N. 106 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information required under Appendix II of the Annex to the Convention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: information required under Regulation B-2.3 of the Annex to the Convention.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: An electronic record book may be used for recording matters to be recorded in the Record Book only if the electronic record book is approved by the following authority after taking into account the guidelines developed by IMO—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a Hong Kong ship—the Director or an organization recognized under section 37A; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a non-Hong Kong ship—an Administration. (L.N. 106 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: The owner and the master of a ship must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each operation concerning ballast water is recorded in the Record Book without delay;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (subject to paragraph (ba)) each entry in the Record Book is signed by the officer in charge of the operation concerned and each completed page of the Record Book is signed by the master; (L.N. 106 of 2025)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: if an electronic record book is used for recording any matter required to be recorded in the Record Book under this section—all entries for the matter are verified by the master without delay; (L.N. 106 of 2025)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the entries in the Record Book are made—

subparagraph.content: in one of the working languages of the crew of the ship; and
unless that working language is English, French or Spanish, also in English, French or Spanish; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: all exemptions in respect of the ship granted by the Director or an Administration in relation to the Convention are recorded in the Record Book.

subsection.content: If the entries in the Record Book are also made in an official language of the state whose flag the ship is entitled to fly, and there is an inconsistency between the entries made in the official language and those made in one of the languages referred to in subsection (2)(c), the entries made in the official language are to prevail.

The Record Book must be kept on board the ship in a place so as to be readily available for inspection at all reasonable times and must be continued to be so kept until the expiry of 2 years after the date of the last entry made in it.
The Record Book must be kept by the owner of the ship for a further period of 3 years after the expiry of the period referred to in subsection (4).
The Record Book may form part of the electronic recording system of the ship.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Shipboard personnel assigned to conduct ballast water management
section.leadIn: The owner and the master of a ship must ensure that each member of the crew of the ship who is assigned to conduct ballast water management is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: familiar with the procedures for the operation of ballast water management in so far as it relates to the duties assigned to the member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: familiar with the Ballast Water Management Plan of the ship in so far as it relates to the duties assigned to the member.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Sediments management
section.content: Sediments from any tank, space or compartment of a ship designated for carrying, loading or discharging ballast water must be removed and disposed of in accordance with the Ballast Water Management Plan of the ship.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Application of Part 3 and Requirement for Certificates etc.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Application of Part 3
section.content: This Part applies to a Hong Kong ship of 400 gross tonnage or above.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an International Ballast Water Management Certificate in force in respect of the ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other certificate or document in force in respect of the ship certifying or confirming that the requirements under Article 7 of the Convention are complied with in relation to the ship.

subsection.content: The owner of a ship may apply to the Director for an IBWM Certificate in respect of the ship.
The application must be accompanied by the prescribed fee for the Certificate.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must not issue an IBWM Certificate in respect of a ship unless the Director is satisfied—

subparagraph.content: if an IBWM Certificate has never been issued in respect of the ship—an initial survey of the ship has been carried out in accordance with section 25; or
if an IBWM Certificate has been issued in respect of the ship—a renewal survey of the ship has been carried out in accordance with section 26; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that, on the evidence of a declaration of survey forwarded to the Director under section 25 or 26, the Ballast Water Management Plan of the ship and the structure, equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements, material and processes of the ship associated with the Plan comply with the requirements of the Convention.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Recognition of inspection carried out before commencement date

subsection.content: If all the conditions specified in subsection (2) are satisfied in relation to a ship, the Director may issue an IBWM Certificate in respect of the ship even though no initial survey of the ship has been carried out in accordance with section 25.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an authorized organization had, before the commencement date—

subparagraph.content: carried out an inspection of the ship; and
based on the result of the inspection, issued a preliminary certificate certifying that the requirements under Article 7 of the Convention are complied with in relation to the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the preliminary certificate has been issued for more than 3 years before the date of application for the IBWM Certificate in respect of the ship, the preliminary certificate bears an endorsement by an authorized organization, indicating that the organization—

subparagraph.content: has inspected the ship between the second anniversary date and the third anniversary date of the preliminary certificate; and
is satisfied, based on the result of the inspection, that the requirements under Article 7 of the Convention are complied with in relation to the ship; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied, based on the preliminary certificate and any other documents and information provided by the owner of the ship, that the Ballast Water Management Plan of the ship and the structure, equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements, material and processes of the ship associated with the Plan comply with the requirements of the Convention.

subsection.content: Subject to the provisions of Divisions 3 and 4, an IBWM Certificate issued under subsection (1) is valid for the period specified by the Director in the Certificate, which must not exceed 5 years beginning on the date of the preliminary certificate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized organization (獲授權機構) means a member of the International Association of Classification Societies authorized by the Director to issue preliminary certificates in relation to the Convention in respect of Hong Kong ships before the commencement date.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Duration of IBWM Certificates issued after initial surveys

subsection.content: Subject to the provisions of this Division and Division 4, an IBWM Certificate issued in respect of a ship as a result of an initial survey under section 25 is valid for the period specified by the Director in the Certificate, which must not exceed 5 years beginning on the date of completion of the initial survey of the ship.
For the purposes of this Division, an IBWM Certificate issued in respect of a ship is to be regarded as a certificate referred to in Regulation E-5 of the Annex to the Convention.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Duration of IBWM Certificates issued after renewal surveys
section.content: A new IBWM Certificate issued in respect of a ship as a result of a renewal survey under section 26 is valid for the period specified by the Director in the Certificate in accordance with Regulation E-5 of the Annex to the Convention.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Duration of IBWM Certificates after early completion of surveys

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an intermediate survey of a ship is completed before the period within which the survey is required to be completed under section 27; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an annual survey of a ship is completed before the period within which the survey is required to be completed under section 28.

subsection.content: After a survey of a ship is completed as described in subsection (1), the existing IBWM Certificate issued in respect of the ship must be endorsed to show a date described on the endorsement as the “new anniversary date”, which must be a date that is within 3 months from the date of completion of the survey (new anniversary date).

For the purposes of any intermediate survey or annual survey to be carried out in respect of the ship under section 27 or 28 in any year subsequent to the endorsement, the period within which the survey must be carried out is to be ascertained by reference to the new anniversary date.
The duration of an existing IBWM Certificate issued in respect of the ship may be varied by the Director in accordance with Regulation E-5 of the Annex to the Convention.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Extension of validity period of IBWM Certificates in certain circumstances
section.leadIn: The Director may extend the validity period of an existing IBWM Certificate issued in respect of a ship in accordance with Regulation E-5 of the Annex to the Convention if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Certificate is valid for a period of less than 5 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a new IBWM Certificate cannot be issued or placed on board the ship before the expiry of the Certificate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ship is not in the port in which it is to be surveyed when the Certificate expires; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the ship is engaged in short voyages.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Cessation and Cancellation of IBWM Certificates

section.name: s19
section.heading: IBWM Certificates cease to be valid
section.leadIn: An IBWM Certificate issued in respect of a Hong Kong ship ceases to be valid if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a survey referred to in Part 4 is not carried out in relation to the ship before the expiry of the period specified for the survey in that Part;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Certificate is not endorsed under section 27 after an intermediate survey of the ship is carried out;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Certificate is not endorsed under section 28 after an annual survey of the ship is carried out; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the ship is transferred to the registry of a place outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The Director may, by written notice to the owner and the master of a Hong Kong ship, cancel an IBWM Certificate issued in respect of the ship in the circumstances set out in subsection (2).
The circumstances are that the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that the Certificate was issued, or any endorsement on it was made, on the basis of false or erroneous information.
The Director must give reasons for cancelling the Certificate in the notice.
On receiving the notice, the owner and the master of the ship must deliver the Certificate to the Director immediately.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Form, Alteration and Certified True Copies of IBWM Certificates

section.name: s21
section.heading: Form of IBWM Certificates
section.content: The Director may specify the form of an IBWM Certificate.

subsection.content: The owner of a ship in respect of which an IBWM Certificate has been issued may request the Director to alter any of the particulars contained in the Certificate.
The Director may refuse to make the alteration if the Director considers it to be a material alteration.
If the Director agrees to make the alteration, the Director must, on payment of the prescribed fee, alter the Certificate.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Certified true copies of IBWM Certificates

subsection.content: The owner of a ship in respect of which an IBWM Certificate has been issued may apply to the Director for the issue of a certified true copy of the Certificate.
The application must be accompanied by the prescribed fee for the certified true copy.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Application of Part 4
section.content: This Part applies to a Hong Kong ship of 400 gross tonnage or above.

subsection.leadIn: An initial survey of a ship is to be carried out by a Government surveyor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the ship is put into service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: before an IBWM Certificate is issued for the first time in respect of the ship.

subsection.content: If, after having carried out an initial survey of the ship, the surveyor is satisfied that the Ballast Water Management Plan of the ship and the structure, equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements, material and processes of the ship associated with the Plan comply with the applicable requirements of the Annex to the Convention, the surveyor must make a declaration of survey to that effect and forward the declaration to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a renewal survey of a ship is to be carried out by a Government surveyor within 5 years—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from the date of completion of the initial survey of the ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a renewal survey of the ship has been carried out, from the date of completion of the preceding renewal survey.

subsection.content: If the validity period of the IBWM Certificate issued in respect of the ship has been extended under section 18(c) or (d), the period of 5 years referred to in subsection (1) is to be extended by the period for which the Certificate is extended.

If, after having carried out a renewal survey of the ship, the surveyor is satisfied that the Ballast Water Management Plan of the ship and the structure, equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements, material and processes of the ship associated with the Plan comply with the applicable requirements of the Annex to the Convention, the surveyor must make a declaration of survey to that effect and forward the declaration to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: An intermediate survey of a ship is to be carried out by a Government surveyor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the period commencing 3 months before and ending 3 months after the second anniversary date of the IBWM Certificate issued in respect of the ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within the period commencing 3 months before and ending 3 months after the third anniversary date of the IBWM Certificate issued in respect of the ship.

subsection.leadIn: If, after having carried out an intermediate survey of the ship, the surveyor is satisfied that the equipment, systems and processes of the ship associated with the Ballast Water Management Plan of the ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with the applicable requirements of the Annex to the Convention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are in good working order,

subsection.continued: the surveyor must make an endorsement to that effect on the Certificate.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), an annual survey of a ship is to be carried out by a Government surveyor within the period commencing 3 months before and ending 3 months after each anniversary date of the IBWM Certificate issued in respect of the ship.

If an intermediate survey of the ship has been carried out under section 27 by reference to an anniversary date, the annual survey of the ship by reference to the anniversary date for the relevant year is not required to be carried out.

subsection.leadIn: If, after having carried out an annual survey of the ship, the surveyor is satisfied that the structure, equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements, material and processes of the ship associated with the Ballast Water Management Plan of the ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have been maintained in accordance with Regulation E-1.9 of the Annex to the Convention so that the ship remains fit to proceed to sea without presenting a threat of harm to the environment, human health, organisms or amenities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remain satisfactory for the service for which the ship is intended,

subsection.continued: the surveyor must make an endorsement to that effect on the Certificate.

subsection.content: The Director may, by written notice to the owner and the master of a ship, require an additional survey of the ship to be carried out by a Government surveyor within a reasonable period specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may exercise the power under subsection (1) only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after an IBWM Certificate has been issued or endorsed in respect of the ship, significant alterations, replacements or repairs have been made to the structure, equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements or material covered by the survey leading to the issue or endorsement of the Certificate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that section 30 is not complied with in respect of the ship; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Director determines on the basis of an investigation under section 32 that the survey is necessary.

subsection.content: On receiving a notice under subsection (1), the owner and the master of the ship must cause an additional survey to be carried out.
The additional survey may be general or partial as the Director thinks fit.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Duty to maintain condition of ship
section.content: The owner and the master of a ship must maintain the condition of the ship in accordance with Regulation E-1.9 of the Annex to the Convention so as to ensure that the ship remains fit to proceed to sea without presenting a threat of harm to the environment, human health, organisms or amenities.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Certificates to be kept on board
section.leadIn: The owner and the master of a ship must ensure that the International Ballast Water Management Certificate issued in respect of the ship which is in force—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is kept on board the ship; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is made readily available for inspection by a Government surveyor at all reasonable times.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Duty to report accidents or defects

subsection.content: If an accident occurs to, or a defect is discovered in, a ship, and the accident or defect substantially affects the ability of the ship to conduct ballast water management or ballast water exchange in accordance with section 4 or 6, the owner and the master of the ship must report the accident or defect to the Authority.
The Director may, on receiving a report under subsection (1), cause an investigation to be initiated.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Authority (主管當局) means—(a)if the ship is within the waters of Hong Kong—the Director; or(b)if the ship is a Hong Kong ship that is in a port of any Convention country outside Hong Kong—the Director and the appropriate authority of that country.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Power of Government surveyors to inspect, examine, etc. ships

subsection.content: Any of the powers conferred by this section may be exercised for ascertaining whether this Regulation has been or is being complied with.

subsection.leadIn: A Government surveyor may, at any reasonable time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: board a ship that is within the waters of Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take with the surveyor any other person and any equipment or materials required to assist the surveyor.

subsection.leadIn: After boarding the ship, the surveyor may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make any examination and investigation as the surveyor considers necessary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: take samples of ballast water on the ship, or of any article or substance found on the ship, that the surveyor may reasonably require for the inspection, examination or investigation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: inspect, seize and remove from the ship any article or substance in respect of which the surveyor suspects on reasonable grounds that an offence under this Regulation has been committed;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: detain the article or substance for so long as is necessary—

subparagraph.content: for the inspection, examination or investigation; and
to ensure that it is available for use as evidence in any proceedings for an offence under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: take any measurements and photographs and make any recordings that the surveyor may reasonably require for the inspection, examination or investigation;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: require that the ship, or any part of the ship, or anything on the ship, is to be left undisturbed (whether generally or in particular respects) for so long as is necessary for the inspection, examination or investigation;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: require any person who the surveyor reasonably believes is able to give any information relevant to the inspection, examination or investigation—

subparagraph.content: to attend at a place and time specified by the surveyor;
to answer the questions that the surveyor thinks fit to ask; and
to sign a declaration of the truth of the person’s answers;

paragraph.leadIn: require the production of, and inspect and take copies of or of any entry in—

subparagraph.content: any certificates, books or documents that are required to be kept under this Regulation; and
any other certificates, books or documents that the surveyor considers necessary for the inspection, examination or investigation; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: require any person to afford the surveyor such facilities and assistance with respect to any matters or things within that person’s control or in relation to which that person has responsibilities as the surveyor considers necessary to enable the surveyor to exercise any power conferred by this section.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wilfully obstruct a Government surveyor in the exercise of any power conferred by this section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make a statement or sign a declaration that the person knows is false, or recklessly make a statement or sign a declaration that is false, in purported compliance with a requirement under subsection (3)(h).

subsection.content: A person must comply with a requirement imposed on the person under subsection (3).

section.name: s34
section.heading: Director may require ballast water management to be conducted

subsection.content: After an inspection of a ship under section 33(3), the Director may give a direction to the master of the ship requiring the master to conduct ballast water management at the location and within the period specified by the Director.
A master to whom a direction is given under subsection (1) must comply with the direction and conduct ballast water management at the location and within the period specified by the Director.

If an inspection of a ship under section 33(3) reveals a deficiency, the Director may give a direction to the master of the ship requiring the master to cause the ship not to proceed to sea until the deficiency is rectified.

subsection.leadIn: A master to whom a direction is given under subsection (1) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with the direction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take steps to rectify the deficiency; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: inform the Director once the deficiency is rectified.

subsection.content: If the ship is a Hong Kong ship and the deficiency is not rectified within the period specified by the Director, the Director may, by written notice to the owner and the master of the ship, withdraw the International Ballast Water Management Certificate issued in respect of the ship.
On receiving a notice under subsection (3), the owner and the master of the ship must deliver the Certificate to the Director immediately.
The owner or the master of the ship may, after the deficiency in respect of the ship has been rectified, apply to the Director for the return of the Certificate.

On receiving an application under subsection (5), if the Director is satisfied that the deficiency in respect of the ship has been rectified, the Director must, by written notice to the applicant, return the Certificate to the applicant.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Director may appoint Government surveyors
section.content: The Director may appoint a person to be a Government surveyor for the purposes of this Regulation.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Director may recognize organization to survey ships and issue certificates etc.
section.leadIn: The Director may recognize an organization for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carrying out surveys of Hong Kong ships in conformity with Part 4;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issuing International Ballast Water Management Certificates in respect of Hong Kong ships in conformity with Part 3;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: making endorsements on the International Ballast Water Management Certificates that are issued by the organization in conformity with Part 4;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: with the prior written consent of the Director, granting extensions of the validity periods of the International Ballast Water Management Certificates that are issued by the organization;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: altering any particulars contained in the International Ballast Water Management Certificates that are issued by the organization;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: issuing certified true copies of the International Ballast Water Management Certificates that are issued by the organization; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: specifying any corrective actions (other than those referred to in section 35(1)) that the organization considers necessary to be taken in respect of Hong Kong ships.

section.name: s37A
section.heading: Director may recognize organization to approve electronic record books
section.content: The Director may recognize an organization for approving an electronic record book for a Hong Kong ship, after taking into account the guidelines developed by IMO.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Director may request Convention countries to survey Hong Kong ships and issue or endorse certificates
section.leadIn: The Director may request any Convention country—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to carry out a survey of a Hong Kong ship of 400 gross tonnage or above on behalf of the Director in conformity with Regulation E-1 of the Annex to the Convention; and

subparagraph.content: issue an International Ballast Water Management Certificate in respect of the ship in conformity with Regulation E-2 of the Annex to the Convention; or
endorse on an International Ballast Water Management Certificate issued in respect of the ship in conformity with Regulation E-2 of the Annex to the Convention.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Director may at request of Convention countries survey non-Hong Kong ships and issue or endorse certificates
section.leadIn: The Director may, at the request of any Convention country—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause a non-Hong Kong ship that is within the waters of Hong Kong to be surveyed under Part 4 as if the ship were a Hong Kong ship; and

subparagraph.content: issue an IBWM Certificate in respect of the ship under Part 3 as if the ship were a Hong Kong ship; or
endorse on an International Ballast Water Management Certificate issued in respect of the ship in conformity with Regulation E-2 of the Annex to the Convention.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Director may grant exemption
section.content: The Director may exempt any ship or class or description of ships from any of the requirements of this Regulation on such conditions as the Director may specify, and the Director may alter or cancel any such exemption.

subsection.content: If any of the requirements in section 4(1) or (2), 6, 7, 8(1), (2) or (4), 9, 10, 12, 29(3), 30, 31, 32(1), 34(2) or 35(4) is contravened in respect of a ship, the owner and the master of the ship each commits an offence.
If section 8(5) is contravened, the owner of the ship concerned commits an offence.
A person who contravenes section 33(4) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.
A person who fails to comply with section 33(5) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine at level 6; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 3.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (1) or (2) to show that the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the commission of the offence.

If an offence under this section is committed or would, but for the operation of subsection (6), have been committed by the owner or the master of a ship due to the act or omission of some other person, that other person also commits the offence and may be charged with and convicted of the offence, whether or not proceedings are taken against the owner or the master.
The Director must keep a copy of the English and Chinese texts of the Convention at the office of the Director.
The Director must allow the public to inspect the texts free of charge at the office during normal office hours.
During the transitional period, a contravention of section 12 or 31 does not constitute an offence under section 41.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: transitional period (過渡期間) means the 1-year period beginning on the commencement date.
